name: Rüppell's Vulture
description: The Rüppell's Vulture is a high-flying scavenger, known for soaring at extreme altitudes.
spread_note: Found in East and West Africa.
food_note: Can fly up to 11 km high, spotting carcasses from afar.
proportions: Wingspan: 2.3-2.6 m, length: 85-100 cm, weight: 6-9 kg.
reproduction: Lays 1 egg in a cliff nest, incubation about 55 days.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to specific needs, but notable for their flight.
projects_note: Endangered due to poisoning; conservation is critical.
